column1: // From: Jonathan Saul Caine, 2001. Fracture Network, Fault Zone, and
// Geologic Data Collected from the Turkey Creek Watershed, Colorado Rocky
// Mountain Front Range.U.S. Geological Survey, Denver, CO Open
// TURKEY CREEK WATERSHED FRACTURED BEDROCK AQUIFER CHARACTERIZATION:
// ELEVATION: 6800 Feet SCAN LINE NUMBER: SL 1 285 S
// PHYSICAL LOCATION: US 285, Mid Turkey Creek Canyon, under power lines on
// LITHOLOGY: Xm / f-spar, qtz, bio foliated and ptygmatically folded gneiss

column10: sl cp, r, <1mm 166 62 w 1.77 tip tip none sl cp, r, <1mm, SL ||
sl cp, stpd BREAK IN SL sl skip to 5m, peg dike @ 5.2 to 5.4m cut by fracs
sl cp 80 32 sfol, many dm scale folds Note; small cliff to south sl face || fracs w spacing ~2-3 m and ~TL's 4-5 m. END
